TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EndpointReference extends System.Object

remarks.format:
## Remarks The wsa:EndpointReference element can be used in wst:OnBehalfOf and wp:AppliesTo elements inside of a wsp:RequestSecurityToken element to specify an endpoint reference.
Supports either the WS-Addressing standard schema namespace (http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/08/addressing) or the WS-Addressing 1.0 schema namespace (http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing) when reading. On write only the WS-Addressing 1.0 namespace (http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing) is supported.
For more information about the wsa:EndpointReference element, see the Web Services Addressing â€“ Core specification. For more information about its use in WS-Trust protocols, see the version of the WS-Trust specification that applies to your scenario.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string uri) cil managed

Docs.param: An absolute URI that specifies the address of the endpoint reference. Initializes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.Uri%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified URI.
Gets a collection of the XML elements that are contained in the endpoint reference. The wsa:Address element is not included in the collection.
Docs.value: A collection of the XML elements that are contained in the endpoint reference.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The collection contains all of the child elements of the wsa:EndpointReference element except the wsa:Address element. The collection is populated by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.ReadFrom%2A> method.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.Uri%2A> property contains the value of the wsa:Address element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference ReadFrom(class System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader reader) cil managed

Docs.param: The XML dictionary reader from which to read the endpoint reference.
Docs.summary: Reads a wsa:EndpointReference element from the specified XML dictionary reader.
Docs.returns: The endpoint reference read from the XML dictionary reader or if the wsa:EndpointReference element cannot be read.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.ReadFrom%2A> overload topic for details.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference ReadFrom(class System.Xml.XmlReader reader) cil managed

Docs.param: The XML reader from which to read the endpoint reference.
Docs.summary: Reads a wsa:EndpointReference element from the specified XML reader.
Docs.returns: The endpoint reference read from the XML dictionary reader or if the wsa:EndpointReference element cannot be read.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.ReadFrom%2A> overload topic for details.

Docs.summary: Gets the URI that specifies the address of the endpoint reference.
Docs.value: The address of the endpoint reference.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Represents the contents of the wsa:Address child element of the wsa:EndpointReference element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void WriteTo(class System.Xml.XmlWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The XML writer to which to write the endpoint reference.
Docs.summary: Writes the as a <wsa:EndpointReference> element to the specified XML writer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Only supports writing the WS-Addressing 1.0 standard schema namespace (http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing). The wsa:Address element is written first with the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.Uri%2A> property, then the other elements specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference.Details%2A> collection are written.
